      Constructor creates VTM db with name given in parameter.

      • updateTask

        public boolean updateTask(Task task)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates a task given as parameter. Remember that task which you got from the database remembers its name, even if it was modified in runtime. You can change the name of the task and when performing this method, the right one in db will be modified.
        Parameters:
        task - task you want to update
        Returns:
        true if the operation went positive, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        Returns:

      • addExecutedTask

        public boolean addExecutedTask(Task task,
                               long startTime)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds an executed task to the database. First parameter is an ordinary Task and the ExecutedTask is created with connection with it.
        Parameters:
        task - task which will be connected with created ExecutedTask
        startTime - time in ms since Jan 1, 1970
        Returns:
        true if the operation went positive, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • updateExecutedTask

        public boolean updateExecutedTask(ExecutedTask task)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates given executed task. The same mechanism as in updateTask(Task)
        Parameters:
        task - executed task you want to update
        Returns:
        true if the operation went positive, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
